DOCNAME: CASE OF DAVLETKHANOV AND OTHER “CHERNOBYL PENSIONERS” CASES v. RUSSIA
JUDGES: Anatoly Kovler;Christos Rozakis;Dean Spielmann;George Nicolaou;Giorgio Malinverni;Sverre Erik Jebens
TEXT: CARDINAL . The applicants , whose names and DATE of birth are tabulated below , took part in the cleaning - up operation at the GPE nuclear disaster site . They were subsequently registered disabled , becoming entitled to various social benefits .
CARDINAL . On various dates the applicants successfully sued authorities for inflation adjustment of these benefits . The judgments became final .

CARDINAL . On various dates the ORG of higher courts allowed the defendant authorities ' applications for supervisory review ( in the case of PERSON it was the applicant who initiated supervisory review of the judgment of DATE , asking reversal of its part unfavourable to him ) and quashed the judgments , considering that the lower courts misapplied the material law ( see details of the judgments in the table below ) .

CARDINAL . The relevant domestic law governing the supervisory review procedure before DATE is summed up in the ORG 's judgment in the case of ORG v. GPE ( no . CARDINAL/CARDINAL , § § DATE , ORG CARDINALIX ) , from DATE in the ORG 's judgment in the case of GPE v. GPE ( no . CARDINAL , § MONEY , CARDINAL DATE ) .
